TopicTitle: I'm waiting for KSP interstellar for .24

Articles.Content: Anyone else waiting? I like .24, but without Interstellar, the game feels more empty without it. So until it updates, i'm going to just play .23.5.
Me too. And I want the update for Remote Tech 2. Patience is a virtue. Of course... I'm not that virtuous.

Indeed. It'd be great once Interstellar, Remotech, and other mods. I can now finally download so many mods thanks to 64bit and not crash. Thank you squad for implementing it, even though another person discovered it.

I have faith in the TR Team, but Interstellar, hope there will be a 0.24 version also B9, they somehow belong together for me.

Both great mods, but ist just one day after release...
I know. I am waiting for them to be updated. Even if it takes awhile.
I'm also taking the plunge with FAR and DRE this update. I'm going to need to redesign all of my lifters. I'm going to have to learn how to design flyable spaceplanes too.
im not incredibly tech savvy, is there a way to revert from .24 to .23.5? i finally learned how all the parts work with each other and now they just collapse on launch with new update

im not incredibly tech savvy, is there a way to revert from .24 to .23.5? i finally learned how all the parts work with each other and now they just collapse on launch with new update

The only way that I know of, is that in steam you can go back to prevous stable version. Don't know if there is a way to do it if you've bought it on their website.

WaveFunctionP have made an update to KSPI, so that it works on 24.1, yet there are a lot of bugs. The same goes with B9, you can get it to work, but it is not balanced balanced, and it's technically not updated for the current version of KSP.

Edited July 25, 2014 by LightningFarm
